div1.p: Members of the Press Club of North Platte chose twenty writers they would like to hear from, and we hope that you can find time to write us at least one paragraph of advice, which will be read at our spring luncheon, May 28th.

Our group has placed manuscripts in several classifications, though no one sale has been really outstanding. We do have a few good workers, though, who intend to keep trying to do better work, and we certainly will welcome a few lines from you if you will forgive us for asking that favor of a busy person.

Doctor Neihardt, I was in Omaha when you spoke to Nebraska Writers in the autumn of 1958. It was something I shall always remember, hearing you repeat your lines telling of the hearts of the Indians during their times of confusion and anguish. It was sad to hear, but beautifully written and we heard it as only the man who wrote it could have presented it to us. I followed you outside the Town House that day to thank you, and want to thank you again for coming to the Guild that day and giving us that time to remember.

Mildred Bennett speaks or writes of you so often that I have felt I kept in touch since I last saw you. She let me read some books she had bought upon your recommendation, and they have been helpful to both of us.

div1.ab:
North Platte May 9 PM 1960 Nebr.
Pray for Peace
